wordpressPost.title: HOW TO LIVE A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE
wordpressPost.content:
HOW TO LIVE A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE

 

Even if you haven’t been living the healthiest way, it’s never too late to start.

For me, I tend to live by the 80/20 rule of eighty percent of the time living as healthy as I can and the other twenty percent in doing whatever the heck I feel like.

Life is meant to be enjoyed and living a rigid lifestyle is not a fun way to live, if, you ask me.

 

How to live a healthy lifestyle

 

Here are the basics of living a healthy lifestyle:

 

  • If you smoke, STOP!
  • Exercise and get some physical activity every day.
  • See a  doctor every year.
  • Get enough sleep
  • Find something that you love to do and do it.  A hobby, cooking, writing, whatever, just do it for the joy and yourself.
  • Eat a healthy diet with less fat, fewer animal products, and more organic fruits and veggies.
  • Drink lots of clean water.
  • Supplement.
  • Use lots’ of herbs instead of salt and seasonings.
  • Reflect, meditate, or do yoga daily.
  • Reduce stress and tension as much as possible.
  • Find your joy.

 

Smoking will kill you if you do it.  I’m sure if you do smoke you already know this as I know it can be difficult to stop, but it is going to kill you sooner than later.

The importance of regular exercise is that it’s a key factor in overall health.  We all know this, yet many of us only get a fraction of the physical activity that we need.

Not only does exercise help with stress and better cardiovascular health, but it also enhances the transport pf oxygen and nutrients into our cells.

The benefits of exercise 

 

  • Increases muscle strength
  • increases flexibility and stamina
  • Creates stronger bones
  • Lowers resting heart rate
  • Strengthens heart function
  • Lower blood pressure
  • Improves oxygen delivery
  • Enlarges the arteries to the heart
  • Increases blood supply to muscles
  • Reduces heart disease risk
  • Lowers our bad cholesterol
  • Raises our good cholesterol
  • Prevents osteoporosis
  • Improves our immune system
  • Increased endurance
  • Promotes lean body mass and burns fat

Exercise also provides a natural release for tension, anxiety, and stress.  This, in turn, improves our mental outlook and helps relieve some types of depression.

Why you should see a doctor every year

 

  • To establish any health risks that you may have.
  • To keep your body in check so that you can monitor any changes.
  • To maintain good mental health.
  • To combat sleep issues.
  • Prevention because prevention is better than a cure.
  • Routine screenings.
  • Keep your health care costs down.
  • Peace of mind.

 

Why you should get enough sleep

 

Sleeps value to our health and proper functioning is without question vital to our entire wellbeing.  Many health conditions like depression, chronic fatigue syndrome and other diseases are related to sleep deprivation.

How much sleep do you need? Each person requires sleep at different levels.  I have to have about eight to nine to feel my best.  I am envious of people who say that they only need four or five hours of sleep per night.  Wow, I could get a lot more done if I only needed four or five.  Sorry, I’m digressing but, still, it’s a fantasy of mine not to need to sleep so much.

Back to our point.  As we age our sleep needs,loose tend to decline and with that, so does their ability to stay asleep. This is because we have a decrease in brain chemicals such as serotonin and melatonin levels.

 

Find something you love to do

 

 

I’m sure that I don’t have to tell you that when you are doing something that you enjoy, this is when you are the most content and happy.

Being happy by finding a hobby or something that you enjoy regularly doing benefits as follows:

  • Happiness protects your heart.
  • Your immune system.
  • Combats stress.
  • Improves mood and depression
  • Happy people have fewer aches and pains.
  • Combats disease.
  • Lengthens our lives.

One quick suggestion.  Don’t turn the thing that you love to do into a business or job because many become unhappy when the thing that they love becomes a machine that they are no longer in control of.

Eat a good diet and drink clean water

 

It has been established that certain dietary practices can cause or prevent disease.  The following are ways to have a health-promoting diet:

 

  • Eat a plant based diet.  Primarily vegetarian.  If you can’t then limit meat of any kind (that includes fish) to two to three times a week.
  • Reduce fat intake.
  • Eliminate sugar.
  • Reduce exposure to pesticides and herbicides.  Eat organic.
  • Eliminate additives like food coloring, etc.
  • Eat whole foods and stay clear of packaged foods.
  • Lower salt intake.
  • Drink 32 to 48 ounces of filtered water per day (or more).
  • Identify if you have food allergies and steer clear of them.
  • Stay withing a daily calorie intake to maintain ideal body weight.

 

Supplementing

I supplement every day with supplements such as vitamin D, vitamin C, fish oil, vitamin B and, about five or six others.  I get my levels checked once a year, so I know where I stand with regards if what I’m doing is working or just a waste of money.

I feel better while supplementing because when I miss a day or two, I notice a difference.

Here is what the FDA says about supplements:

 

What are dietary supplements?

“Dietary supplements include such ingredients as vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, and enzymes. Dietary supplements are marketed in forms such as tablets, capsules, soft gels, gel caps, powders, and liquids.”

source: http://www.fda.gov/Food/ResourcesForYou/Consumers/ucm109760.htm

What are the benefits of nutritional supplements?

“Some supplements can help assure that you get enough of the vital substances the body needs to function; others may help reduce the risk of disease. But supplements should not replace complete meals which are necessary for a healthful diet – so, be sure you eat a variety of foods as well.”

http://www.fda.gov/Food/ResourcesForYou/Consumers/ucm109760.htm

Unlike drugs, supplements are not intended to treat, diagnose, prevent, or cure diseases. That means supplements should not make claims, such as “reduces pain” or “treats heart disease.” Claims like these can only legitimately be done for drugs, not dietary supplements.”

How to take supplements

Are there any risks in taking supplements?

“Yes. Many supplements contain active ingredients that have strong biological effects in the body. This could make them unsafe in some situations and hurt or complicate your health. For example, the following actions could lead to harmful – even life-threatening – consequences.”

  • Combining supplements
  • Using supplements with medicines (whether prescription or over-the-counter)
  • Substituting supplements for prescription medicines
  • Taking too much of some supplements, such as vitamin A, vitamin D, or iron
    Some supplements can also have unwanted effects before, during, and after surgery. So, be sure to inform your healthcare provider, including your pharmacist about any supplements you are taking.
  • source:  http://www.fda.gov/Food/ResourcesForYou/Consumers/ucm109760.htm

Deciding to take supplements is a personal thing and one that should be decided along with your doctor as some supplements interact with certain drugs.

 

The importance of Reflection, meditation and, Joy

 

 

Taking time out of your day either in the morning fresh or anytime that you can to reflect and pause is beneficial to our health

Physical Benefits of Meditation

With meditation, the physiology undergoes a change and every cell in the body. i

On a physical level, meditation:

  • Lowers high blood pressure
  • Lowers the levels of blood lactate, reducing anxiety attacks
  • Decreases tension-related pain, such as tension headaches, ulcers, insomnia, muscle and joint problems
  • Increases serotonin production that improves mood and behavior
  • Improves the immune system
  • Increases the energy level, as you gain an inner source of energy

source:  http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/meditation/meditation-for-you/benefits-of-meditation

Mental Benefits of Meditation

“Meditation brings the brainwave pattern into a relaxed state that promotes healing. The mind becomes fresh, delicate and beautiful. With regular practice of meditation:

  • Anxiety decreases
  • Emotional stability improves
  • Creativity increases
  • Happiness increases
  • Intuition develops
  • Gain clarity and peace of mind
  • Problems become smaller
  • Meditation sharpens the mind by increasing focus and expands through relaxation
  • A sharp mind without expansion causes tension, anger, and frustration
  • An expanded consciousness without sharpness can lead to lack of action/progress
  • The balance of a sharp mind and an expanded consciousness brings perfection

Meditation makes you aware – that your mental attitude determines your happiness.”

 http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/meditation/meditation-for-you/benefits-of-meditation

Other Benefits of Meditation

Emotional steadiness and harmony

It cleanses and nourishes you from within and calms you, whenever you feel overwhelmed, unstable, or emotionally shut down.

Meditation brings harmony in creation

When you meditate, you are in the space of vastness, calmness, and joy and this is what you emit into the environment, bringing harmony to the Creation/planet.

Personal Transformation

Meditation can bring about a real personal transformation. As you learn more about yourself, you’ll naturally start discovering more about yourself

source:  http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/meditation/meditation-for-you/benefits-of-meditation
